**Both bar charts and histograms are important elements of statistics.**

Histograms visualize quantitative data or numerical data, whereas bar charts display categorical variables.

In most instances, the numerical data in a histogram will be continuous (having infinite values)Unlike histograms, bar charts have a finite set of categories.

The histogram is used to showcase a graphical presentation that represents the data in the form of frequency; whereas a bar chart is also a graphical representation of data and the information that is used for the comparison of two categories. 

a bar chart is used in summarizing categorical data,a histogram uses a bar of different heights, it is similar to the bar chart in many terms but the histogram groups the numbers into the ranges while representing the data.
